description: Named the "Best Weekend All Year," this internationally renowned three-day equestrian event in Kentucky is one you won’t want to miss.

description: Plan your trip to Basel, Switzerland and witness the absolute best riders and horses on Earth at the World Cup Finals.

description: The world’s best Equestrians face off in London. Watch 3 FEI World Cup Qualifiers, including the Longines FEI Jumping World Cup.

description: Show Jumpers from around the world collide in Wellington, Florida to compete and set the tone for the rest of the year.

description: Watch young riders and juniors from across the country meet to compete in this Olympic-style event to determine North America’s best of the best.
notificationCopy: Cheer on the next generation of equestrians during the North American Youth Championships.

eventName: The Al Shira’aa Hickstead Derby Meeting
description: First held in 1961, the Hickstead Derby is one of the most historic and popular classes in showjumping. Witness the 10ft 6in slope of the Derby Bank, the infamous Devil’s Dyke, and one of the widest water jumps in the world.
notificationCopy: See a showjumping  event that’s as wild as it is historic.

description: The biggest Equestrian sporting event in the world meets the most prestigious horse show in Europe.
notificationCopy: Be a part of the biggest equestrian sporting event in the world.

eventName: Longines League of Nations at the World Equestrian Center
description: One of the toughest competitions in the world. 10 nations compete across 5 locations worldwide for the title of the strongest equestrian nation. See the US leg of the tour in Ocala, Florida.

description: One of the toughest and most exciting equestrian events—the pinnacle of the worldwide horse trials calendar.

description: Located just steps from Vancouver, Thunderbird Show Park is one of North America’s premier equestrian event facilities; hosting nine weeks of globally recognized hunter and jumper tournaments per year!

description: There’s only one event that deserves the title of “The Place To Be In October,” and that’s the Maryland 5*. Home to top sport, incredible tailgating, and lush scenery, this event perfectly combines the beauty of Maryland with some of the toughest competition.

description: Help make equestrian sports more accessible by heading downtown to watch the Philadelphia Polo Classic. All the proceeds from the event go towards the Work To Ride program which will benefit future junior riders under the poverty line.

eventName: Samba Deer - Hound Hunting Season Open
actualDatesSpan: Apr, May, Jun, Jul, Aug, Sep, Oct, Nov
description: The open season for hunting Sambar Deer, the largest deer in Australia, using scent-trailing hounds is restricted to 1 April - 30 November each year, with some exclusions. Check local authorities for exact regulations.
notificationCopy: Open season is now underway in Victoria.

description: The open season for Stubble Quail is timed to occur when the population is at its maximum and to avoid periods of vulnerability. The closed season is timed to prevent hunting during breeding, molting, temperature extremes and food shortage. Check local authorities for exact regulations.
notificationCopy: Open season is now underway in Australia.

description: The annual season occurs during the month of April, which is timed to minimize impact on breeding productivity. Victoria is one of the few places where wild populations of Hog Deer can be hunted free-range on public land. Check local authorities for exact regulations.
notificationCopy: Open season is now underway in Victoria.

description: Tahr are best hunted over these months to experience the rut. The tahr bulls are also in their peak winter capes at this time. Check local authorities for exact regulations.
notificationCopy: Gear up and get out there. The Tahr rut is going wild.

description: By far the most productive and exciting time to hunt trophy fallow is during the rut. Check local authorities for exact regulations.
notificationCopy: Gear up and get out there. The deer rut is going wild in Australia.

description: New Zealand duck hunting season runs May through July and typically coincides with prime hunting for many big game species. Check local authorities for exact regulations.
notificationCopy: Open season is now underway.

description: Water buffalo hunts in Northern Australia take place from June-October, because of the wet season which typically ends in May. Check local authorities for exact regulations.
notificationCopy: Hunting water buffalo is a big game adventure second to none. See you out there.

description: Australia is the only place in the world to hunt Banteng, with the Northern Territory being the home to the largest population of Banteng. Check local authorities for exact regulations.
notificationCopy: It's the dry season which means it’s time to head out to get a Banteng.

description: Pigs forage during the day in cooler months, but this can make them scattered and more difficult to locate. During the uncomfortable warmer months, feral pigs are more predictable – traveling to and from water during the more temperate night hours to find food. Check local authorities for exact regulations.
notificationCopy: The warmer months mean wild bore are easier to hunt.

notificationCopy: Find out why it was voted the best festival & rodeo in North America.

description: With over 75 vendors, we celebrate and gather to honor women of the West. Workshops and clinics are designed to introduce and preserve traditional western arts and trades as well.
notificationCopy: The contributions of these cowgirl makers are truly worth celebrating.

description: Australia's toughest rodeo athletes go head-to-head at AELEC's main arena for an adrenalin filled three days and nights of rodeo.
notificationCopy: Tune in to see some of the toughest cowboys and cowgirls in Australia.

actualDatesSpan: Feb, Mar, Apr, May, Jun, Jul, Aug, Sep, Oct, Nov
description: Experience the electrifying adrenaline rush of PBR! This is your chance to witness talented bull riders going head-to-head with powerful bucking bulls in this must-see competition.
notificationCopy: Bring on the bulls. Check out one of the stops on the PBR Tour in Australia.

description: The National Finals Campdraft is one of the biggest events on the drafting calendar with hundreds of riders competing each year. Riders compete throughout the year to accumulate points, with the top point scorers invited to compete at the National Finals.
notificationCopy: Check out the country’s best junior and senior riders as they go head-to-head.

description: An iconic point break surrounded by rich surf culture, Snapper Rocks is known as one of the longest and best waves in the world.
notificationCopy: Don't miss the 6th stop on the World Surf Tour - Snapper Rocks Pro.

description: Lower Trestles is now a regular tour stop for the WSL.
notificationCopy: Tune in and watch the World Surf League compete at the Trestles Pro.

eventName: West Coast Wax Up presented by YETI
description: Traditional longboard event, with over 60 competitors battling it out for prize money. The event includes an expression session showcase and 'team extravaganza' heat.
notificationCopy: Celebrate traditional longboarding with us on the Victorian Surf Coast.

description: Indigenous surfing competition that has been running for over 25 years and attracts surfers from all over the country to battle it out for the prestigious trophy across 14 divisions.
notificationCopy: Celebrate surfing and surf culture alongside Indigenous Communities at the 27th annual competition.

description: ASFF is New Zealand’s annual surf film festival held at the end of summer. In true kiwi style, a curated selection of international and kiwi surf feature films, documentaries and short films is taken to the masses!
notificationCopy: The best of surf culture and surf cinema all in one festival.

location: WA, SA, VIC, TAS, QLD & NSW
actualDatesSpan: Apr, May, Jun, Jul, Aug, Sep, Oct
description: From the raw power of Western Australia to the groomed pointbreaks of Queensland, the city beaches of Sydney and the cold water wonders of Victoria, there is every type of wave for every kind of surfer in Australia. No other country offers a surf adventure with such variety, consistency and beauty.
notificationCopy: Choose your own adventure. Different parts of Australia offer the perfect surf conditions for beginners to pros.

description: A Fourth of July tradition in Oregon, the St. Paul Rodeo is a staple event during the summer for those in the northwest. Offering a world class rodeo event in honor of Western Heritage, every year the community and non-profits benefit from the St. Paul Rodeo to the tune of more than $250,000.
notificationCopy: Grab your tickets to the St. Paul Rodeo and celebrate the start of this summer's Cowboy Christmas.

description: The Wild Sheep Jurassic Classic is a fishing event that supports wild sheep in British Columbia. It's a collaboration between the Wild Sheep Society of BC (WSSBC) and the Guide Outfitter Association of BC, with support from the Wild Sheep Foundation. The event includes sturgeon fishing, conservation, and raffles.
notificationCopy: Join us for the annual sturgeon fishing experience on the majestic Fraser River!

description: The Surf Canada Nationals, also known as the Rip Curl Nationals, is a three-day surfing competition that determines Canada's national surfing team.
notificationCopy: Tune in to see who will be named to Canada’s National Team!

description: The Toronto Sportsmen's Show is a well-known outdoor event in Canada that features products and services for anglers, hunters, boaters, campers, and other outdoor enthusiasts.
notificationCopy: Embrace the outdoors at Canada’s favorite fishing, hunting, boating, outdoors & sportsmen’s show.

eventName: Quebec City Outdoor, Hunting, Fishing and Camping Show
description: Experience the ultimate outdoor showcase in Quebec. Join us at the largest outdoor, hunting, fishing & camping show, co-located with the Quebec Boat Show gear up for your next thrilling adventure.
notificationCopy: Industry veterans and newcomers are welcome - see you in Quebec City.

description: Experience the electrifying adrenaline rush of PBR! This is your chance to witness talented bull riders going head-to-head with powerful bucking bulls in this must-see competition.
notificationCopy: Bring on the bulls. Check out PBR in Canada!

description: The Wild Sheep Society of British Columbia's (WSSBC) Ruck in the Shulaps is an event where conservationists track wild sheep in the Shulaps Mountain Range to gather information for biologists. The WSSBC is an organization that works to protect wild sheep in British Columbia.
notificationCopy: Join us to track wild sheep in the Shulaps Mountain Range.

description: An event for riders of all skill levels that features product tryouts, expert chats, and free events. Some of the events include the YETI Hip Jam, Banked Slalom, and Empire Rail Jam.
notificationCopy: Join us in celebrating our passion for snowboarding at two events during the winter.

description: The Great Ontario Salmon Derby is a not for profit event that has been running on Lake Ontario in its current format since 1996. The legendary Great Ontario Salmon Derby continues to generate revenue for all communities across the North Shore of Lake Ontario.
notificationCopy: Join us to support the Lake Ontario Salmon fishery.
